theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p10: They both ate in silence, taking extra time to savor the delicious homemade pumpkin pie with whipped cream, then cleaned up the dishes. After a while, when they had both gotten ready for bed and crawled in together under the covers, they kissed again and wished each other a goodnight before turning the lights out. Surprisingly, Ray was able to fall asleep rather quickly this evening, and he drifted deeply into a dream…
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p11: Ray stood there in the hallway, just outside of the courtroom still wearing his Judge’s gown, and he was surrounded by reporters all holding up microphones and cameras that were flashing and clicking. They were almost like animals surrounding their prey, snarling and nearly foaming at the mouth as they asked him questions, pushing closer and closer to him. “What are you going to do about this case? Where’s your secret power now?”, one reporter shouted, catching Ray by surprise. “Yeah Ray! Yeah! What about it? Do you really think your secret power is working? Can you trust it? Can we trust you?”, another reporter snarled viciously at him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p12: “Order! Order in the court!” Ray shouted over all the noise. “We’re not in court anymore, Ray! You have no power here! No order!” someone in the crowd screamed at him. Ray wiped beads of sweat from his forehead, trying to calm himself down and think of how to handle this crazy situation he’d gotten himself into. “Listen! You don’t understand, it’s not that easy. Just give me a chance to explai…”, he was immediately cut off by hands beginning to grab at his gown, tearing it in the process. He kept getting pulled back and forth by the crowd until…
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p13: “Ahhh! What are you doing!? Stop!” he shouted, trying to pull away from the reporters’ mouths biting at his arms, back, and legs. His shouts fell on deaf ears, however, with more snarling and biting reporters climbing over each other to get a piece of him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p14: “Ahhhhh, ahhhhh, ahhhh!!!!” Ray screamed and thrashed in his sleep, waking up Sil in the process. “Ray! Wake up, wake up!”, she shouted as she shook him awake. “You’re okay, it’s just a dream”, she said as he sat up and wiped beads of sweat from his forehead. “Ohhh, wow, um…” Ray stuttered shakily. “Y-yes, I-I’m okay. Wow, what an insane dream.”
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p15: “Do you want to talk about it?” Sil asked him softly. He reached over to the nightstand on his left, grabbed the glass of water, and drank the whole glass in a few large gulps. Wiping the remaining beads of sweat from his forehead, he turned to look at Sil and replied, “No, I’m okay now. You’re right, it was just a bad dream. I guess I’ve got some worries about this case, but it’s nothing I can’t handle. I’ll be alright.” She looked at him for a moment, concern showing in the wrinkles of her scrunched expression. “Alright, well, if you change your mind or want to talk in the morning then you know I’m always here for you. I love you, please try to get some more rest”, she responded.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p16: “I love you too, and sure, of course”, Ray said as he lay back down. Despite calming down and closing his eyes, he could only seem to toss and turn in bed, filled with worried thoughts of what that insane dream could possibly mean. Then, after what seemed like hours, he finally drifted back off to sleep.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p18: Raymond sat there in the driver seat of his car, gripping the steering wheel tightly with white knuckles as he saw the parade of news vans and cars parked just up the road, in front of the courthouse. `Damn, again? They’re like vultures! They circle around their prey, waiting for just the right moment to dive and tear into their next meal. Is it me, or is it Quinton that they’re circling though?` he thought as he clenched his teeth. “Agh!” he shouted, slamming the palm of his hand down onto the steering wheel, then turned to go into the parking garage behind the courthouse.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p19: He parked and went straight to his office. Once again thoughts were swimming through his mind, only this time he could feel their pace quickening as they approached the inevitable waterfall into anxiety and insanity. How appropriate this waterfall in his mind was, given the fact that Mr. Jefferson happened to have fallen, or potentially have been pushed, off of a cliff. The incessant sound of murmuring voices in the hallway from all of the reporters didn’t help things either. Today was the day when Ray would have to give his speech to the media and announce the date on which the verdict would be made regarding this case.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p20: Normally, a case like this would span months, but it seemed as though Quinton really wanted to exercise his right to a fair and especially speedy trial. His lawyers had continuously bombarded Ray with notices and motions and requests to move forward with this. It was as if he was being pressured to make a hasty decision, but why? Wouldn’t a hasty decision potentially give Quinton a verdict he wouldn’t be happy with? But wait, why even care about whether or not Quinton would be happy with the verdict? This is about making the right decision, not keeping the defendant happy.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p21: Ray opened the top drawer on the right side of his desk and grabbed a bottle of Paracetamol, twisted the cap and popped several of the pills into his mouth. He swallowed dryly, nearly gagging in the process, and then began massaging his temples. Lately it seemed like he was beginning to have more and more headaches, but he continued to attribute these to the growing stress of this case. `If these headaches don’t quit after I’m done presiding over this case, I’ll go to a doctor.` he thought to himself, exhaling sharply.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p22: Looking at the watch on his left wrist, he saw that it was time to give the speech and he took in three deep breaths to calm his nerves. “Okay, let’s do this, '' he said to himself, gathering up his strength and confidence. He walked over to the door that led to the hallway filled with the incessant murmuring of the reporters, took in one last deep breath, then twisted the handle and opened the door.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p23: Immediately numerous camera clicks could be heard as the flashes illuminated the hallway like strobe lights. Fortunately, this time Raymond had a podium to stand behind as he gave his speech to the reporters, unlike his dream where he had been surrounded by ravenous and almost inhuman reporters.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p24: He cleared his throat and straightened his tie as he stood behind the podium, prompting all of the reporters and attendees to quiet down for his speech. “I would just like to preface this speech by reiterating that we do respect the presumption of innocence until proven guilty here, and the fact that we are moving forward with the case against Quinton Franks does not mean anything without proof beyond a reasonable doubt. That being said, we do have reason to believe that this case is worth a judge’s ruling in addition to a trial. The trial will be held next week on Monday, beginning at 8am and will span three days. I will use the following two days after the trial to review all evidence that has been submitted, as well as the findings of the jury. The Monday of the following week will be when a judgment is announced. If Mr. Quinton Franks is found to be innocent, then all charges will be dropped. If Mr. Quinton Franks is found to be guilty, then a separate hearing will be held to determine the sentencing, which will occur the following Monday after the verdict has been announced.”
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p25: Ray slowly took in another deep breath, and then announced that he will take a few questions. “I will now allow questions and I’ll answer to the best of my ability. Remember, this is still an open case so I will not be answering any questions about the case itself, and I will not be answering any questions regarding my opinions about this case.”
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p26: Immediately the reporters all began asking questions, each reporter trying to be louder than the others in order for their question to be heard. It felt like chaos, and immediately Ray began to feel a bead of sweat rolling down the side of his face as he remembered the nightmare. Wiping away the sweat, he listened for a clear question which he was able to answer.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p27: “Judge Elisando, can you please tell us whether or not you’ve ever presided over a murder case like this before, and why you’re the judge who has been deemed qualified to preside over this particular case?” a reporter in the middle of the crowd shouted. Raymond cleared his throat to signal the reporters to be quiet so he could answer, and then responded by saying, “First, I’d like to say that I have presided over hundreds of cases during my career, including cases involving manslaughter, murder, burglary, and many other charges. Each case is unique, despite circumstances sometimes seeming similar to other cases, so in that respect, no, I have never presided over a murder case like this before. I am, however, indeed qualified to preside over this case and I have no doubts that I will make a lawful decision based objectively on all of the evidence provided, and I will take into consideration the decision of the jury. The Governor is aware of the publicity and high-profile nature of this case, and he himself decided I would be the one to preside over this case. I trust his decision, and I trust my judgments.” “Thank you Judge Elisando!” the reporter said, while jotting down notes onto his iPad.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p28: The reporters again began to shout over one another as they asked all different kinds of questions. After responding to the first question, however, Ray felt much more confident and he answered questions for the remaining time without any issue.  `Hah, and to think I was fretting about this meeting as if it would happen as it had in my dream. That actually went surprisingly well. Maybe tonight I’ll finally get some good sleep again`, he thought. Soon, he was heading home and finally feeling good about moving forward with this case…
theDreamyManTextsList.author: Auteur: Mitchell Wintrow

settings.font.nexaInfo: Il s'agit d'une police de très haute qualité et elle fonctionne bien avec toutes les langues disponibles dans cette application pour la traduction. C'est également la même police qui a été utilisée à l'origine lors de la création de la photo de couverture du livre physique que j'ai écrit pour vous.
settings.font.serifInfo: Cette police est l'une des polices disponibles sur tous les systèmes téléphoniques Android, et je viens de l'inclure afin que vous ayez la possibilité de lire les choses plus facilement avec une police similaire à celle que vous verriez sur un document Google ou Word. Il convient également de noter que cette police fonctionnera avec toutes les langues disponibles pour la traduction dans cette application.
settings.font.robotoInfo: Cette police fonctionne également avec toutes les langues disponibles pour la traduction dans cette application et est incluse dans tous les systèmes Android. Il est très similaire à Serif et très facile à lire, cependant, je pense qu'il est encore un peu plus fluide et plus propre que Serif, c'est donc un bon choix pour une lecture facile. De nombreux sites Web utilisent cette police particulière.
settings.font.robotoBoldInfo: This font also works with all languages available for translation in this app, and it's included in all Android systems. It's very similar to Serif and it's very easy to read, however, I think it's even a bit smoother and cleaner than Serif, so this is a good choice for easy reading. Many websites use this particular font.
settings.font.lobsterInfo: This font is a fun and playful font, and it seems to work well with all languages available for translation in this app. It's a good choice for when you want to read something with a bit of character and fun. 🦞
settings.font.lobster2Info: This font is a fun and playful font, and it seems to work well with all languages available for translation in this app. It's a good choice for when you want to read something with a bit of character and fun. 🦞 (This is just the newer updated version of the original Lobster font)
settings.font.lobster2BoldInfo: This font is a fun and playful font, and it seems to work well with all languages available for translation in this app. It's a good choice for when you want to read something with a bit of character and fun. 🦞 (This is just the newer updated version of the original Lobster font)
settings.font.prataInfo: This font is a very easy to read font, and it seems to work well with all languages available for translation in this app. It has a nice clean look while still adding a bit of character to what you're reading.
settings.font.shadowsIntoLightInfo: This clean, neat handwriting font has a feminine feel with nice rounded edges and curves. 💅🏻
settings.font.ubuntuInfo: This font is what is used on the Linux Ubuntu operating system, and it has a clean and easy to read look. It seems to work with all languages available for translation in this app, and it's also worth noting that this font is used on many websites and in many apps.
settings.font.ubuntuBoldInfo: This font is what is used on the Linux Ubuntu operating system, and it has a clean and easy to read look. It seems to work with all languages available for translation in this app, and it's also worth noting that this font is used on many websites and in many apps.
settings.font.angelinaInfo: D'après ce que je peux dire, il semble que cette police ne fonctionne pas spécifiquement avec le russe, cependant, elle semble bien fonctionner avec toutes les autres langues. Cette police n’est fondamentalement qu’une option amusante avec laquelle vous pouvez jouer, car elle peut être difficile à utiliser pour la lecture.
settings.font.bauhaus_lightInfo: Cette police semble très facile à lire, et j'en ai inclus une version légère et moyenne pour ce que vous préférez. Je pense que cette police a un joli look épuré tout en ajoutant un peu de caractère à ce que vous lisez.
settings.font.bauhaus_mediumInfo: Cette police semble très facile à lire, et j'en ai inclus une version légère et moyenne pour ce que vous préférez. Je pense que cette police a un joli look épuré tout en ajoutant un peu de caractère à ce que vous lisez.
settings.font.frankInfo: À l'origine, la seule raison pour laquelle j'ai inclus cette police est sa capacité à fonctionner spécifiquement avec l'hébreu. Cependant, j'ai rencontré de nombreux problèmes pour que les traductions en hébreu fonctionnent correctement. J'ai décidé de laisser cette police ici en option, juste au cas où je parviendrais enfin à faire en sorte que les traductions en hébreu se comportent correctement. Il semble que le logiciel de codage que j'utilise n'apprécie pas les langues qui se lisent de droite à gauche 😅...
settings.font.hummingbirdInfo: Je sais que cette police est probablement assez difficile à lire, et en plus elle s'affiche beaucoup plus petite que toutes les autres polices, mais je voulais l'inclure pour vous à cause de son nom : "Police Colibri" 😘. Malheureusement, il semble que cette police ne fonctionne pas avec le russe, mais elle semble fonctionner avec les autres langues.
settings.font.ananiasInfo: Cette police semble très facile à lire, d'autant plus qu'elle semble s'afficher beaucoup plus grande que toutes les autres polices, et que les lettres sont écrites très clairement tout en ayant leur propre caractère. Il semble fonctionner avec la plupart des langues, à l'exception du russe, malheureusement encore une fois. Il semble qu'il existe de nombreuses polices qui ne jouent pas avec le russe 😅.
settings.font.corruptionInfo: J'ai spécifiquement inclus cette police pour que vous puissiez lire en russe et en ukrainien avec une sorte de police sympa, car aucune des autres ne semble bien fonctionner avec les lettres cyrilliques. Je te ❤️ et je t'embrasse 😘. Cette police semble avoir une sensation et un caractère amusants et presque comiques.
